description: You see a bush that burns but is not consumed. A voice calls your name: "Moses, Moses!"
You find a sturdy staff on the ground. It may be useful later.
God speaks to you from the bush: "Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground."
You run away, but the memory of the burning bush stays with you.
God gives you a mission: "Go to Pharaoh and bring my people out of Egypt."
You accept God’s mission. Your journey begins! You travel to Egypt to confront Pharaoh.
You refuse, but God encourages you to trust Him.
You stand before Pharaoh. He looks at you with suspicion. "Let my people go," you declare.
Pharaoh is surprised by your gift. He seems less hostile, but still refuses to let the people go.
You attempt to negotiate with Pharaoh. He offers to let only some people go.
Some Israelites are freed, but many remain. The story ends with hope for the rest.
Pharaoh refuses to let the Israelites go. God tells you to warn him of plagues.
You throw your staff down and it becomes a snake! Pharaoh’s magicians do the same. Pharaoh is unimpressed.
The plagues begin: water turns to blood, frogs, gnats, and more. Pharaoh’s heart remains hard.
The final plague strikes: the death of the firstborn. Pharaoh finally lets the Israelites go.
You reach the Red Sea. Pharaoh’s army is pursuing you! The people panic.
You try to find another way, but get lost in the desert. The journey is much harder.
The sea miraculously parts! Do you lead the people through?

options.text: Go back to the safety of Egypt and rule under Pharaoh.
Lead the people through the sea

description: You lead the people through the dry seabed. The waters close behind you, drowning Pharaoh’s army.
At Mount Sinai, God gives you the Ten Commandments. The people begin a new life as a free nation.
You have led your people out of Egypt and received God’s law. The adventure continues in the wilderness...
